result.execSummary:
The defendant Rogelio Guarnero was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: With Huber release for work, consecutive to any other sentence.

Court ordered defendant to sign up for probation no later than 4:00 pm on 08/31/2022.
Probation Review Hearing scheduled for November 11, 2022.

miscConds.notes:
- Defendant to pay all mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DV and DNA surcharges during the period of probation. Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment.
- Court WAIVED all other court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.
-  Any cash bail on deposit to apply if applicable.
- Court set restitution at zero.

- No contact with firearms.
* Court advised defendant due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

- No contact with BAW unless approved by the court.
- Third party contact for the purpose of time with children, as approved by agent.

- Complete batterer's intervention program.
- Provide a DNA sample during the term of probation.
- Defendant must cooperate with the court order in 20FA454 (exactly as written).

timeConds.notes: With Huber release for work, STAYED pending review.

charges.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rogelio Guarnero

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Rogelio Guarnero appeared by video.  Attorney Katherine Graber appeared by video for Rogelio Guarnero.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for Plea/ Sentencing Hearing. 

Parties have reached an agreement. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.

As to Count 1: Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Parties prepared to proceed with sentencing. State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.

As to Count 1: Court sentenced the defendant to serve 6 months in the House of Correction, with Huber release for work, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 0 days served. 
Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 12 months.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
- As to Count 1: Serve 30 days condition time in the House of Correction; with Huber release for work, STAYED pending review.
- Complete batterer's intervention program.
- No contact with BAW unless approved by the court.
- Third party contact for the purpose of time with children, as approved by agent. 
- No contact with firearms.
- Provide a DNA sample during the term of probation.
- Defendant to pay all mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DV and DNA surcharges during the period of probation. Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment.
- Court WAIVED all other court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.
- Any cash bail on deposit to apply if applicable.
- Court set restitution at zero.
- Defendant must cooperate with the court order in 20FA454 (exactly as written).

*Court advised defendant of appellant rights. 
*Court advised defendant due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
*Court ordered defendant to sign up for probation no later than 4:00 pm on 08/31/2022.

Probation review hearing scheduled in Branch 29.
Probation Review Hearing scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Plea Questionnaire/Waiver and Addendum

Attorney Katherine Graber in court, defendant Rogelio Guarnero not in court, in custody.  Lisa M Valenti-Jordan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Scheduling conference held. Defense counsel requests a plea and sentencing hearing.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  This hearing may be streamed live at the discretion of the Court via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Attorney Katherine Graber in court, defendant Rogelio Guarnero not in court, in custody.  Lisa M Valenti-Jordan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Pre-trial conference held. Defense counsel needs discovery and an offer from the State and requests a scheduling conference.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  This hearing may be streamed live via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Court ordered no contact with BAW
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Rogelio Guarnero in court with attorney Katherine Graber.  Defendant Rogelio Guarnero in custody.  Jessica Ann Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Rogelio Guarnero appeared by video means with Attorney.  Pursuant to Misdemeanor Division Directive 99-01, defendant is advised this case is reassigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  This hearing will be streamed live via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
